review_title: Do not recommend working for Lifewell
job_title: Clinical Support Specialist in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
I learned something new everyday.

Decent choice of medical and dental insurance plans.
cons:
Pay is too low for the amount of responsibility this job requires. 

A majority of clients were treated as a burden instead of someone with a mental illness who deserves quality care. Case managers and teams were oftentimes seemingly annoyed when asked to assist with a client in person or over the phone. 

Uncoordinated. Ex: the ACT team was aware the Dr. was not going to be in one day. Two clients checked in and waited over an hour. We emailed the team two times, and after 30 mins got a response that the "doc wasn't in yet". After another 30 mins and additional call to the team, we were finally informed he wasn't in today so the clients would not be seen. 

High turnover (6 case managers and 3 supervisors quit within the 2 months I worked there) with no effort to retain employees.

My goal was to eventually become a case manager but after seeing a majority of their attitudes and case loads, I knew that would be a mistake.

Offer better benefits and more PTO.

review_title: Lifehell, never work here,  there are other PNOs if you want SMI experiance
pros:
Leaving
The PTO was decent
Nothing else
cons:
Management 
Movement in the company 
Pay
If your not a butt kisser don't try and apply for promotions. They want people who are Yes men, not people who can do their jobs. 
Upper management will never blame their suck ups for company faults, but put blame on hard workers.
They love the term "lateral move" they don't want to pay you for getting promoted or moving to a new spot.

pros: Pay was good. Hours were good.
cons: Too much expectations to meet goals

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Work-life balance, friendly staff, welcoming environment, good communication, structured, organized. Great benefits!
cons: Lack of growth opportunities in the HR Department.

review_title: Must enjoy caring for the needs of the mentally ill
pros: Flexibility with time off requests, upper management is supportive although changes move slow. 30 minute appointments. Working with the mentally ill population takes patience but is very rewarding because you truly make a difference in their lives.
cons: The EHR is monumentally slow and cumbersome resulting in taking a lot of work home. Too much. There is a high turnover of staff here unfortunately largely due to the population served.

pros: helping mentally ill people is fulfilling, when you do
cons: passive aggressive manager and management doesnt care

cons: they are not any cons

cons: Un realistic job expectations regarding home visits and paper work completion with difficult co workers and staff.

pros: the light workload for the team
cons: case managers do not follow up with clients

review_title: Some professionals and some head scratchers for sure.
pros: Overall good company with the right focus on taking care of clients.
cons: Very high case loads leading to very little opportunities for providing services to clients outside of groups.

pros: Currently has crisis pay and OT
cons: Management is awful, there is a great deal of bullying.

pros: The people are very kind and have high expectations for work performance.
cons: There seems to be high turnover in some of the departments.

review_title: They will give you a start.
pros: Little to no experience required to begin.
cons: Very limited resources for employees and clients makes it difficult to make real progress or change.

review_title: Avoid this company at all cost!
pros: If you work in administration. You get free lunches and an office to yourself.
cons: The executives do not care for their works. Case managers and Clinicians are forced to work long hours with little support. The clients do not receive the needed help

pros: We get to work with a population of special adults.  I believe that the work I do makes a difference. Working at Lifewell allows me this experience. I also have had 2 wonderful supervisors that have inspired me to stick around.
cons: There are many.  Low pay.  Very expensive benefits (which were presented to us as if we were getting a "deal").  Lack of appreciation for the amount of work we do considering so many people have quit and we have to pick up their job duties.  Lack of training.  Lack of communication.  Records reflecting our production and note timeliness are in accurate,  which affects our bonus opportunity. The company "can't afford" simple things we need to do our jobs.

pros: It was close to my apartment. Literally that's it.
cons:
1. Management is more concerned with "productivity" then actually helping members. There is so much fraud going on in order for them to make numbers every month. While I was there a CC was fired for making fraudulent notes and I'm sure they swept it under a rug like an isolated event, when everyone knows that it's a common thing and even encouraged. One day Mercy Care will catch on. 
2. The turn over rate for Case Managers is so high because we go through so much mentally, physically and spiritually, with very littler reward. They would rather train and hire less effective case managers versus doing the work to keep experienced case managers)
3. At one point, my team had only 3 case managers. My case load was at 60 at one point. 
4. There were (and would not be surprised) transportation issues for clients. Either drivers would be late or wouldn't show up at all. They never effectively handled this problem. At one point, I had to take a client home everyday after work. 
5. Because everyone is stressed and on edge, it was by far the most hostile work environment I've worked in. It felt like high school again. I talked to management about this and they basically minimized my claims even though multiple people complained about this person. 
There is definitly more, but I'll keep it short.

job_title: Clinical Support Specialist in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Co workers are someone of the most genuine people and love what they do. They care about the clients well being. I made some very good friends. I loved my job.
cons: Upper Management does not care about how their supervisor's abuse their staff. When you report to HR about the hostile work environment along with providing all the evidence to back up your allegations they do nothing about it. In fact it gets worse and the devistating part about all this is the other members of management is they witness the way you get treated and they say nothing to back you up. The only thing they do is tell you to report it to HR because it is not allowed and it's against the company's policy. Honestly, I would of known about this I would have never taken the position. I believe 100% that your employer should back up their employees when another employee that is in a management position is mistreating their staff because of their ethnicity.

review_title: Good for fresh graduates that need to get their foot in the door, THAT'S IT!
pros: This company is good to get your feet wet, get some experience, to then be able to move on to a company that actually cares about you and the clients. Some positions are M-F. They provide training that you can beef up your resume with. Good medical and dental benefits that you usually don't have to pay much out of pocket for. PTO accrues fast after your first year.
cons: This company is very top heavy, and anyone above a coordinator level is very detached from operations and has no idea what is really needed, but has all the power to call the shots. Depending on your location, and who you get as a supervisor, it can be a very toxic work environment. They are very money oriented, so they push for you to hound clients and provide services in ways that gets the most billing, even if it means stretching the truth in the documentation. They have very little regard for your safety as an employee, and will only follow procedures if it is mandated by law, not because they are doing it to protect you. They don't give raises, ever everrrrr. They use archaic technology that is at least 10 years old. They don't seem to care that this company is a revolving door, since they will just keep hiring people that have lower expectations about pay and then train them to just blindly follow orders. If you bring up concerns with the higher ups about things that need to be addressed, you will get their favorite dismissive response of "You should just be thankful you have employment", and then they will can you a month or so down the road on a random Friday because of "financial cutbacks".

pros: I worked at the residential treatment facility and loved my clients and my ability to help others.  I really enjoyed the difference I was able to make in people's lives.
cons:
No work/life balance. Extreme micromanagement. Only care about filling beds and making cash instead of actually helping people work through issues.

It was a great program when I started, but seven years later, it was completely terrible.

pros: Provides basic entry level experience. I had three different positions over a span of four years and really learned a lot. That was really because I am passionate about the field, not because management taught me anything. They provided some resources and I did the rest on my own. I met some cool people at Lifewell who also left the company as they were able to see the agency for what it is. As a supervisor you can basically do whatever you want. It is really hard to get fired.
cons:
Lifewell is the worst community behavioral health agency. If you are thinking of applying here, don’t. Any other agency would be better way better because it is likely that those employees actually care and support each other. I’ve never seen a company so poorly managed. I have never seen a group of people care so little about others. When I try to explain my experience at Lifewell to others they are in disbelief that an agency could be so atrocious and allow so many unethical and unsafe things to happen. 
Lifewell is the type of company where if someone has a problem, they can assign this problem to another employee and never look back. I had HUGE problems dumped on me without a supervisor ever thinking twice about how my workload, work/life balance, or emotional well-being was effected. They literally say “this is your problem now” and walk away. When I went to my supervisor with a concern she would say “well I don’t know what to tell you” or “I don’t know how I can help.” You may think I am joking but this is 100% truth. 
Once a client threw an object at my head. Luckily I ducked and it ended up breaking the window. When I expressed concern to my supervisor she stated “I don’t know what you’re so afraid of”. Yes, this actually happened. A woman who is supposed to be a licensed counselor is unable to understand safety concerns after a client almost gave me a concussion. 
An angry staff member damaged my personal belongings. It was absolutely clear that this was a threat and this agency did nothing at all about it. I really do not know how this management sleeps at night. 
If you think you want to work here, trust me – you don’t. For your own safety, physically and mental health do not apply here. Please, navigate your web browser away from this page and apply somewhere else. Don’t put yourself through the trauma and angst that I, and many others, have endured.

review_title: Everything wrong!  Is a zero star rating.
pros: Met some really genuine people.
cons: Disrespect,  company/management wants you to embellish notes for clients, revolving door for employees,  the employees that remain work their butts off; and that's just good enough for the organization because they only want bodies.  Bodies to work the shifts/bodies to fill the beds.  Numbers and productivity and if you are slow to produce that's when you have the attention of management.   No raises.   Revolving door; staff are always leaving! Miserable.

pros: The ability to take time off was fairly easy and the PTO  accumulated ant a decent rate after your first year of employment. You also received a decent amount of Payed Holidays.
cons: The work environment appeared to be very unprofessional. Coworkers seemed to regularly create situations the were in violation  of HIPPA.

pros: Lifewell offered a variety of job opportunities to grow within the company. They offered flexible hours with great benefits. Work is always steady and leadership was strong.
cons: They company was unable to pay employees any raises due to budget. Without  the work completed by case managers and management, the company would not last.

job_title: Clinical Support Specialist in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Good people & management overall excellent management structure. Clientele are typically good people as well. Room to move up in the company as well.
cons: No salary increases. Behavioral health field can be very challenging in that layoffs can happen when overall budget is reduced by political forces.

pros: It is an income, but you will soon find need to move on - and do it.
cons: Worst place to work ever. Administration doesn't know what they are doing and have no regard for staff and consumers. Most staff are on edge daily for their jobs.

pros: Great training client oriented overtime potential great mission and goals and really work well with this population of clients
cons: Management management management!! Favoritism and settle for anyone as long as there is a body to work there

pros: The benefits are not too bad!
cons: This is micromanagement at it's finest! Beware; big egos work here!

pros: Good experience; Better than similar companies; relaxed about needing time off.
cons: Pay can be fair but you need to negotiate salary; super confusing and unorganized when looking for resources for clients; high turnover; many employees who slack-off on behalf of clients; billing-focuses to the point of absurdity.

pros: True culture of caring for members. Excellent rehabilitation programs.
cons: Residential programs are staffed by underpaid and often jaded employees. Unhappiness among leadership trickles down to staff.

review_title: Good for Clinicans starting in the field
pros: Good learning experience. Quarterly Bonus based on productivity.
cons: No consistency or contuity with leadership, high  turnover ,constant fear of write ups and reprimands, Supports micro management leadership style and focuses too much on money the agency makes and not quality of client care.  Hazardous work environment. Horrible benefits. Poor Life/ Work balance.

pros: Great people to work with at the site
cons: Upper management did not communicate well and made a lot of procedural changes that created confusion and wasted time which resulted in not being able to reach company objectives. Upper management did not listen to even site managers on efficient ways to manage sites. Poor communication with employees.

pros: Direct management is great.
cons: Must clock in and clock out.  Upper management is out of touch.

pros: Good mission statement, good benefits package, incentive pay for meeting clinical goals
cons: Not enough training for case managers before they send them to the clinics, upper management does not recognize or address poor leadership

review_title: I received no training on the EHR and was never paid.
